name: 李曉祺
objective: This course covers fundamentals of mathematics in matrix theory and linear algebra. Emphasis is given to topics that will be useful in other disciplines, including systems of equations, vector spaces, determinants, eigenvalues, and similarity.
schedule:
Week 1: Overview; Systems of Linear Equations
Week 2-3: Row Reduction and Echelon Forms; Vector and Matrix Equations
Week 4: Solution Sets of Linear Systems
Week 5-6: Linear Independence
Week 7-8: Matrix Algebra 01: Basic Operations, invertible theorem 
Week 9: Midterm
Week 10: Matrix Algebra 02: Matrix Partition, Factorization 
Week 11: Linear Transformation and Characteristics of Invertible Matrices
Week 12-13: Determinants; Vector Spaces and Coordinate Systems; Change of Basis
Week 14: Eigenvectors and Eigenvalues; The Characteristic Equation
Week 15: Diagonalization; Orthogonal Sets; Orthogonal Projections
Week 16: Principal Component Analysis 
Week 17: Machine Learning and Linear Models
Week 18: Final
scorePolicy:
Grading -
Homework 15%
Quiz 15%
Midterm 30%
Final 30%
Attendance 10%

Policy on Copying - 
Copying is not acceptable. Do your own work.
materials:
Textbook - 
D. Lay, Linear Algebra and its Applications, 6th Edition, Pearson, 2021.

Reference -
S.H. Friedberg, A.J. Insel, and L.E. Spence, Linear Algebra, 4th Edition, Pearson, 2002.
G. Strang, Introduction to Linear Algebra, 4th Edition, Wellesley-Cambridge Press, 2009.
K.M. Hoffman, and R. Kunze, Linear Algebra, 2nd Edition, Pearson, 1971.
